etymology.description: 珏(珏) (jué, "pieces of jade") + 刀(刀) (dāo, "knife") = cutting jade into pieces -> split or divided -> shift or work group
etymology.interpretation: The character 班(bān) metaphorically represents dividing or splitting work into shifts, akin to cutting jade into pieces. This concept stems from the process of dividing a whole into parts, as suggested by the act of cutting jade.

examples.chinese: 今天我上晚班(今天我上晚班)。
examples.english: Today I work the night shift.

examples.chinese: 他换了班(他換了班)，去休息了(去休息了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huàn le bān, qù xiūxí le.
examples.english: He changed his shift, and then went to rest.

examples.chinese: 天黑后(天黑後)，我开始新班(我開始新班)。
examples.pinyin: Tiān hēi hòu, wǒ kāishǐ xīn bān.
examples.english: After it got dark, I started a new shift.
